page.title: 06 SPECIAL OCCASIONS IN AYNHO
page.content: {MAYTIME IN THE SQUARE} is held every year in May. There are lots of stalls that sell things to raise money for village organisations. There is a procession followed by the Crowning of the MayQueen (a young girl), and the schoolchildren perform Morris, Sword and Maypole dances. The {CHURCH FETE} is held every year in June in the grounds of the Park House. There is a band, and lots of stalls that sell things as well as sideshows, competitions and raffles. The schoolchildren often dance. The money raised goes to the church. {BONFIRE NIGHT} is held on a Saturday near 5th. November. A large fire is lit on the Playing Field and we have singing round the fire followed by a firework display. There is soup and beefburgers to eat. There is a competition for the best guy.
